channel.title: Comments on: SHOW112 Building an XPages App from Start to Finish Session Downloads

item.title: By: Jay Wetherald
item.dc:creator: Jay Wetherald
item.description: <p>Hi Matt,<br/>Excellent resource, thanks. I have one issue. On slide 61, I can't seem to find the "errortext" class in the css file. Am I missing something?</p>
item.content:encoded:
Hi Matt,
Excellent resource, thanks. I have one issue. On slide 61, I can’t seem to find the "errortext" class in the css file. Am I missing something?

item.title: By: Henning Heinz
item.dc:creator: Henning Heinz
item.description: <p>No need to duck away. An answer I got was that you can also use Composite Applications and combine them with XPages.<br/>Not a satisfying answer to me but maybe for others.</p>
item.content:encoded:
No need to duck away. An answer I got was that you can also use Composite Applications and combine them with XPages.
Not a satisfying answer to me but maybe for others.

item.title: By: Ben Poole
item.dc:creator: Ben Poole
item.description: <p><blockquote>what is going to differentiate the Notes client from a Browser</blockquote>Well, Notes will take longer to launch.</p><p>* ducks *</p>
item.content:encoded:
what is going to differentiate the Notes client from a Browser

Well, Notes will take longer to launch.

* ducks *

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>Wayne,</p><p>At the moment, Notes' killer feature is still, after all these years, replication. You can run XPages in your Notes client, replicate your data and still be working on the plane. </p><p>In the medium to long term I tend to agree with you that the lines are all blurring, I suspect we'll see a lot more information as the vision of Project Vulcan begins to solidify.</p><p>Matt</p>
item.content:encoded:
Wayne,

At the moment, Notes’ killer feature is still, after all these years, replication. You can run XPages in your Notes client, replicate your data and still be working on the plane.

In the medium to long term I tend to agree with you that the lines are all blurring, I suspect we’ll see a lot more information as the vision of Project Vulcan begins to solidify.

Matt

item.title: By: Wayne
item.dc:creator: Wayne
item.description: <p>Another excellent xpage resource. <br/>I do have one question though, what is going to differentiate the Notes client from a Browser, or something like Chrome OS?</p>
item.content:encoded:
Another excellent xpage resource.
I do have one question though, what is going to differentiate the Notes client from a Browser, or something like Chrome OS?
